de.tum.bgu.lfk.puicomponents.button

Class PRadioButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • de.tum.bgu.lfk.puicomponents.button.PRadioButton

  • public class PRadioButton
extends java.util.Observable
    a simple radio button for using with processing.
    Since:
    12.02.2015
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Chair of Cartography

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PRadioButton()
      standard constructor.
      PRadioButton(float x, float y, float radius, java.lang.String text, processing.core.PApplet p)
      constructor to place the radio button on location x, y on the canvas
      PRadioButton(float radius, java.lang.String label, processing.core.PApplet p)
      initializes a new radio button and places the button in the middle of the canvas.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PRadioButton

        public PRadioButton()
        standard constructor. do not use

      • PRadioButton

        public PRadioButton(float x,
            float y,
            float radius,
            java.lang.String text,
            processing.core.PApplet p)
        constructor to place the radio button on location x, y on the canvas
        Parameters:
        x - x location of the radio button
        y - y location of the radio button
        text - label of the radio button
        p - the applet to draw on

      • PRadioButton

        public PRadioButton(float radius,
            java.lang.String label,
            processing.core.PApplet p)
        initializes a new radio button and places the button in the middle of the canvas. the setLocation float, float function should be used afterwards.
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the radio button
        label - the label of the radio button
        p - the PApplet

    • Method Detail

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(float x,
               float y)
        convenience function for expandable menu
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • setChecked

        public void setChecked(boolean checked)
        can be set via mouseClicked() function to indicate if the button is checked (marked)
        Parameters:
        checked - boolean true if checked otherwise false

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        queries the status of the radio button
        Returns:
        boolean true if checked otherwise false

      • toggleChecked

        public void toggleChecked()

      • draw

        public void draw()
        draw the radio button. if the button is checked the button is drawn with a dot inside

      • draw

        public void draw(float x,
        float y)
        draws the radio button on the specified location. can be used in PExpandableMenu
        Parameters:
        x - the x location of the radiobutton
        y - the y location of the radiobutton

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(float x,
               float y)
        if e.g. the mouse is inside the radio button area or not
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        true if inside otherwise false

      • setButtonColors

        public void setButtonColors(int buttonStrokeColor,
                   int buttonFillColor,
                   int buttonLabelColor)
        sets the button colors. the color of the marker is the same as the stroke color. in the main Applet the color has to be set via color(grayValue) or color(red, green, blue) etc.
        Parameters:
        buttonStrokeColor - the color of the outline stroke.
        buttonFillColor - the fill color
        buttonLabelColor - the text color

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
